item.title: Random Parcelization
item.description: Random Parcelization Considering files DKTatlas40 (atlas) for marco parcelization and ic4 micro parcelization (uniform) we map the brain and we found a number of randomic variance of this parcelization Phase 2 In order to prepare data and parcelyze randomly patient data you need to perform a series of actions using FreeSurfer scripts. Recall to setup SUBJECTS_DIR and FREESURFER_HOME environment variables to work with FreeSurfer. The actions are: merge all labels in a single label per hemisphere create an annotation (label + colortable) from merged labels apply this label + coloratab to each patient to create the original labelling Subjects directory schema .

item.title: Freesurfer
item.description: Prepare data for FreeSurfer Assume you have a file anat.nii.gz and you want to perform recon-all on it. SUBJECT_ID=tizio INPUT_FILE=<the-path-of-anat-file>/anat.nii.gz Setup directory: mkdir -p $SUBJECT_ID/mri/orig cp $INPUT_FILE $SUBJECT_ID/mri/orig/ Creation of mgz docker run \ --rm \ -v $(pwd)/$SUBJECT_ID:/opt/freesurfer/subjects/$SUBJECT_ID \ -v /usr/local/freesurfer/.license:/opt/freesurfer/.license \ freesurfer/freesurfer:6.0 \ mri_convert \ /opt/freesurfer/subjects/$SUBJECT_ID/mri/orig/anat.nii.gz \ /opt/freesurfer/subjects/$SUBJECT_ID/mri/orig/001.mgz recon-all: Docker version From the machine with the subject data run: docker run \ --rm \ -v $(pwd)/$SUBJECT_ID:/opt/freesurfer/subjects/$SUBJECT_ID \ -v /usr/local/freesurfer/.license:/opt/freesurfer/.license \ freesurfer/freesurfer:6.
